dialogues.text: I'm glad you're having a good time.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Did you listen to a word I just said?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR 0O/S
dialogues.text: I miss you beautiful. Sophia rolls her eyes - he's so transparent.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Miss you too. A WAITRESS brings Victor a plate of food. He smiles his thanks and wafts the steam coming towards his nose.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: If you could see the plate of food I’ve just had put in front of me... Victor eagerly lays a napkin in his lap.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Hey. Can I call you back? I feel like I should have all my senses for this.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Sure. Enjoy. Sophia hangs up. She sighs a sigh that says "Did my boyfr really just get off the phone to pay attention to a meal?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia sits at the desk with her laptop open. She's looki at that cursor blinking at the end of a full page of writ She smiles - pleased at this. There's a knock at her door. She answers. It's Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She's gone to bed - shattered, poor thing.  60.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Think she'll be OK?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, yeah she’1l be fine. Tough as old boots that one. Don’t be fooled by the frail old lady act - she’s Churchill in a dress. Sophia laughs. Charlie smiles. He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You fancy a spot of dinner?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I already ate. I needed to get started. He sees the notebook and laptop.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: How's it coming?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Slowly.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Am I in it?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You are.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Can I read some then?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh go on. Please.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: When it's finished. Maybe.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But how am I to be sure that I'm being properly portrayed? Sophia smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to trust me.  61.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Just a peek. A sentence or two. He tries to look over her shoulder. She blocks his view.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You don't trust me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (matter of fact) You're an American. Sophia can't help but laugh.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You're sure you won't let me read just a bit to ease my mind? Sophia shuts the door. From the other side of the door:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Is this one of those situations where you're really saying the opposite of what you actually mean?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's not.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Right. Good night then.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Good night. They each remain where they are on either side of the clo door smiling and waiting for the other to move. Finally h moves away and she leans back against the door, more than little charmed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is waiting in the lobby writing in her notebook. Charlie comes down the stairs and over to her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Gran's not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What is it? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I don't know.  62.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Should we call a doctor?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Best just let her rest. Sophia suddenly looks and feels very guilty.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have pushed her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It’s not your fault. Truth is she made her decision the moment that letter arrived. And neither I nor the entire regiment of the Household Guard would’ve been able to stop her from coming.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But if I hadn't come back from the airport...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If you hadn’t come back from the airport I would've been denied the pleasure of spending a day in your glorious company showing you the sights of San Gimignano and Siena. Sophia smiles - she feels better already.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You can actually be quite charming when you put your mind to it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh, don't let it fool you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive together through the Chianti countryside.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So what's your story, Charlie?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Not worth telling really. Certainly not worth writing about.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Can't I just be curious?  63.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You can be whatever you want.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Okay. So how does a guy your age come to live with his grandmother?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She lives with me actually.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Well that makes all the difference.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It does rather.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: How does the rest of the family fit in? Mom, Dad, brothers and sisters?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm an only child. Sophia laughs - of course he is.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Why doesn't that surprise me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: ...And my parents were killed ina car crash when I was fourteen. Sophia’s mouth is still open from laughing but she now se incapable of either shutting it or speaking. She just sta

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hit head on by a tourist driving on the wrong side of the road. An American tourist. He reaches over and gently pushes her jaw closed with the tips of his fingers. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I've had ambiguous feelings towards anything American every since.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Understandable. Charlie smirks - trying to ease a maudlin moment:  64.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Could have something to do with my cynicism and pessimism and general lack of faith in true love lasting forever. Not a great believer in happy endings I'm afraid.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (quietly) Oh God, Charlie... Jesus...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes, well, they weren’t much help either. But Gran stepped in and took this angry, bereft and shockingly unpleasant young man under her wing and made me, well, into the superb specimen of screwed- up manhood you see before you now. He laughs. She doesn't. She puts her hand on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry. He looks at her hand on his arm and raises his eyebrows, gently mocking her. She quickly takes her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I owe everything to that woman. She looked after me when no one else would... when no one else could...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: And now it's your turn.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. She... Charlie's voice cracks with emotion. He smiles at her.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sorry. Momentary slip. Won't happen again. Sophia smiles at his English stiff upper lip then looks a out of her window to spare him any embarrassment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIDE SHOT: Of this beautiful town on a hill top with it’s thirteen medieval towers standing proudly against the dee blue Chianti sky.  65. Charlie and Sophia walk through the narrow lanes of the t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk through the ancient square.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They drive through the countryside with the roof of the c down. Sophia’s hair blows around her face so she can’t se She laughs as she tries to tie it up. Charlie smiles. EXT. CATEDRALE DI SANTA MARIA THE “DUOMO”, SIENNA -- DAY They stand outside the wonderful facade of the cathedral. Charlie takes her picture. Then poses with her and holds camera out in front of him and takes another of them both INT. CATEDRALE DI SANTA MARIA THE “DUOMO” -- LATER They walk through the interior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to the three hundred foot tall Mangia Bell Towe

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk up four hundred steps to the top. It’s hard wor for Sophia who stops for breath. Charlie shouts encourage from the top. She laughs, exhausted, and follows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They take in the extraordinary view high over ancient Sie

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk around the National Art Collection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk across the world famous square past the Fonte G (Fountain of Joy). Sophia looks like she’s really enjoyed herself. It’s been the kind of day she never had with Vic  66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia sits outside a cafe. Charlie appears from inside w two of the largest ice cream cones you’ve ever seen.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Little indulgent don't you think? He gives her a cone.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Ah but the thing is, they're calorie free. Clever buggers the Italians. She looks at her cone suspiciously as he starts to eat hi

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes way. Thousands of calories free with every mouthful. Sophia laughs - not at joke but at him for making the jok

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: That was bad.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I thought it was funny. You've no sense of humor. She pushes his ice cream into his face. He takes it away reveal his nose and mouth covered. His stone faced seriousness and slight look of hurt make her laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: That was funny. He wipes his face with a napkin.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's just as well I’m a gentleman otherwise I might be tempted into some sort of juvenile revenge.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I'm grateful believe me. They sit eating their cones for a beat. She looks at him.  67.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I had a great time today. It was nice actually doing the tourist thing with someone. Thanks. He smiles. She studies him for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What's the real reason you're so against Claire being here?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (smirks ) Every good story needs an antagonist right? She's not letting him off that easy.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: There's something else going on in that head of yours. You jealous?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Of an old man I've never met. No.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So? What is it? Are you worried you'll lose her?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Something like that. They sit quietly eating for a beat. Charlie shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Okay...truthfully? It's just that I feel, if we find Alfonso and Gran discovers that leaving him all those years ago was, indeed, the biggest mistake of her life... then what does it say about me and my family? It makes it all a bit of a sham doesn’t it? If they're meant to be then were we not? It's like we're second best.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But you know that's not true.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Maybe. But it feels true. She looks at him as she tries to work this through. He le forward, noticing something on her face.  68.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You've got something on your... With that he pushes her ice cream into her nose. She scre There’s ice cream all over her face. He gets a napkin and gently wipes it off. When he finishes he doesn’t move awa Suddenly both their cell phones ring. They look at them.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Patricia. Victor. Neither of them answer. Charlie looks at her - surprised.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You didn't answer. Very naughty.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Neither did you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: But I have a good excuse. She's a tiresome, self-centered neurotic. She's mad. Madder than a mad cow. Your Victor on the other hand is a dashingly handsome chef about to become a New York culinary sensation, sounds like everything any girl could ever want. Sophia smiles as she knows what Charlie's saying is true.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: He is, I suppose... Her smiles fades. She looks at him sincerely.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (almost to herself) What if I'm not just any girl? Charlie smile diplomatically - he's not gonna go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie’s car pulls up. He and Sophia get out of the car. They walk towards the hotel in silence. Until.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia... She stops and turns. He suddenly looks a little nervous.  69.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say... about today... uh... what I mean is...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Me too. She smiles then turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie and Sophia walk back into the hotel past the bar then both stop. They walk back a few steps and look into There sitting at the bar, large cocktail in hand, sits Cl looking perfectly fit and well as she laughs with the BAR

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Feeling better?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Right as rain dear. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (slowly) Good...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So? How was your day? Did you two get along alright without me? She smiles sweetly as both of them realize in the same mo what she’s been up to. They share a look and a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, Sophia, and Charlie are escorted through a cemete by an old GRAVE DIGGER. They stop. The Grave Digger point a new tombstone and goes off silently. They stand togethe

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (silently; to herself) God, no. Please, no. They look at the grave from a distance. Claire slowly approaches it as Charlie and Sophia hang back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This was what I feared most... Charlie trails off and watches as Claire approaches the g - her back to us. She stops and kneels.  70. Sophia and Charlie stand there saying nothing. Claire sta up and walks back to them. She Long pause.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Is it...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It's not him. My Alfonso's middle name was Paolo. It's not him. Relief washes over Sophia. But not Charlie who still stan there with concern etched all over his face.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: OK. So? We keep looking.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. They turn to him. And wait for him to say more but he jus stands there silently staring as if trying not make a sce

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Charlie, it's not over.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yes it is. It's over. I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But--

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (snaps ) Don’t you see what we're doing? What we’re putting her through? What if it had been him? What if there’s another grave around here with her Alfonso in it? I’m sorry, Gran, I am. But this is the end of the line for me. I can't do this. Claire looks at her beloved grandson and can see the sinc concern and pain on his face. She takes his hand. Sighs.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You're giving up? Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: He's right dear. It's too much. Sophia stares at Charlie. She's stone faced.  71.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: This is what you wanted all along.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. What I wanted was for you to never have written that letter. What I wanted was to never come on this ridiculous goose chase.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Why are you so desperate for this to fail?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm trying to protect her. Because unlike you I can't just stand idly by and watch her get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What is that supposed to mean?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It means you're not here for her. And you're not here 'cause you're some romantic who wants to believe in love lasting forever. You're here for the story. Here to see how it all ends. Doesn't matter to you if it's a happy ending or a sad ending as long as it's compelling right? As long as there's drama.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Charlie. Please. Sophia just stands there stunned, hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You think that's true? Charlie shrugs as if to say “isn't it?".

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm just looking out for her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You're not. You're not walking away for her, you're walking for you. They look at each other. Both fuming. Both pretty sure they've crossed a line.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She’s dealt with enough grief in her life. She's lost her husband, her daughter, her son-in-law. Now you come along and set her up to lose someone she already lost fifty years ago. But why should I expect you to understand. You don't know anything about real loss. This cuts her. She just looks at him for a moment then wa over to the car and gets in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: You're wrong, Charlie. She lost her mother. That was very wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's different.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It is. Her mother chose to leave her. You always knew your parents loved you. She walks back to the car leaving him to think for a mome

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They ride in silence as the sun sets. A very unsmiley car

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia sits at the dressing table brushing her hair. Ther a knock at the door. She thinks for a moment whether to answer it. Another knock. She gets up and opens the door. Claire is standing there.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Just wanted to make sure you were alright.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Of course I am. Totally fine. Hey we gave it our best shot didn’t we?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We did. She sees the hairbrush in Sophia’s hand.  73.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: May I?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (a little taken aback) Sure... She goes back to the dressing table and sits. Claire stan behind her and starts to brush her hair.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: One of the great unsung luxuries in this world - having someone brush your hair.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (smiles) Yeah I guess it is.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: My mother used to do it for me. They continue in silence, then slowly tears begin to fall down Sophia’s face. It’s clearly the first time anyone ha done this since for Sophia since she was a little girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire, Sophia and Charlie look at their menus in silence Charlie steals glances at Sophia who just studies her men He looks at Claire who raises her eyebrows interrogativel if to say “ball’s in your court.” He clears his throat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I should apologize. I was wrong.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You should or you are?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Didn't I just?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I'm not sure that you did. Claire intercedes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: An apology, dear, is when you look at someone straight in the eye with contrition and sincerity and actually say the words “I’m sorry.”  74. He does his best under the scrutiny of his grandmother.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia, I'm sorry... enough contrition and sincerity for you?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Six out of ten.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What'd you want me to do, get on my knees and beg? Charlie starts to do just that. Sophia smiles. She stops

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Please don't. I'm sorry too. Claire smiles as the tension eases. Charlie picks up a wi list.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Excellent. Now that hostilities are over. Let's get drunk. Sophia laughs as the waiter comes over to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: A bottle of your best local Chianti please. The waiter goes off to fetch the wine.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: So, Sophia, what for you now?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Back to Verona, see Bella and the girls, then fly home I guess.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: With the dashingly handsome Victor. She seems slightly perplexed by his saying this and he lo embarrassed like he just thought out loud. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: With the dashingly handsome Victor. Somehow, though, the prospect doesn’t seem so alluring.  75.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Despite what my emotionally stunted pig of a grandson thinks, you did a wonderful thing for an old lady... I'll never forget it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Even though it led nowhere?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It’s been an adventure. There aren’t many adventures left at my age. And It didn't lead nowhere. I got to meet you didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I guess. Though a new friend isn't much consolation for an old love.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Depends on the friend. Sophia smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately you had to meet Charlie, but then we can’t have everything can we?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It wouldn’t have been quite the same without him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Thank you?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: My pleasure. He looks at her - not all sure what that means.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You have a knack of saying things which could be taken as gorgeous compliments or sarcastic digs.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's taken years of practice. The waiter arrives with the wine. He pours them a glass e

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: To Alfonso, wherever he may be.  76.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE/SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Alfonso... They raise their glasses and drink.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Damn that’s good wine.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: (looking at the bottle) Isn’t it? She smiles broadly.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: But then so it should be. She turns the bottle round to them.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Look at the label. Charlie picks it up and reads it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: “D’Annunzio”, How do I know that name? Sophia and Claire share a smile and a shake of the head.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I sometimes find it hard to believe I’m actually related to you.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You don’t think... As the penny drops, Charlie beckons the SOMMELIER.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Excuse me. The makers of this wine. Are you familiar with them?

dialogues.speaker: SOMMELIER
dialogues.text: I am. Yes. Claire hardly dare ask.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: And is there an Alfonso Paolo D’‘Annunzio?

dialogues.speaker: SOMMELIER
dialogues.text: Signora, there are three.  77.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is at her laptop typing. She looks out of the wind for a moment and sees Charlie wandering out of the hotel the garden. He looks up at the sky and then lies down on lawn, his arms spread-eagled. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia comes out of the hotel and wanders over to him.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Just looking at the stars. She lies down beside him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You can see the Milky Way.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's awesome. She laughs and hits him. Charlie is no longer looking at night sky.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You have a wonderful laugh.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You have a wonderful frown. Slight pause. They both look away.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So what do you think will happen tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: If it’s him?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Oh it’s him alright.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: How d’you know?  78.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because we've come too far, it'd just be too unfair if it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Charlie? Am I hearing right? Is that optimism I detect?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm capable of it on occasion.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Well whatever happens, something tells me they’1l be great friends.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I hope so. She deserves it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: She does.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And what about you? What’s in the stars for you and Victor? We can tell Sophia has been thinking about this.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Wish I knew.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Successful business? Marriage? Lots of dashing children?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Successful business, marriage, lots of kids, Victor becomes a celebrity chef, travels the world cooking for royalty while I stay at home microwaving leftovers for the kids.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And you think I'm cynical.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: When it comes to cynicism and love we're not even in the same league.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sounds like we'd make quite a pair.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Shame I'm spoken for.  79.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You don't strike me as the kind of girl who'd let anyone speak for her? She smiles. He sits up. He's confused.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So what about all that romantic true love codswallop you peddled about Gran and Alfonso then?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I want them to prove me wrong. That's all. I want to believe two people can reconnect and it can all be OK. I’m clinging to the wreckage of “there’s always hope.” Charlie looks at her. It suddenly makes sense to him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Because of your mom. Yeah? She looks at him. Shrugs as if to say "probably".

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's what a shrink would tell me. They lie there in the grass in silence for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You know all the things your parents are supposed to give you - safety, food, a roof over your head - the one thing everyone takes for granted is the most important... unconditional love. She smiles at him bravely. A tear falls down her cheek. H leans over and wipes it away. She manages another smile.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Sorry. Momentary slip. Won’t happen again. He smiles at her humor. She looks at him. He looks at her There's a moment. Then suddenly he kisses her. And she ki back, hungrily, passionately. For a few seconds they're unaware of anything but each other. Then Sophia's head catches up to her heart. She pulls bac  80.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Okay. Time out. Not good. I mean too good. So really not good. She gets up and heads back into the hotel. He stands up.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia... wait... I... She starts running and she’s gone. He pauses a moment the walks into the hotel. As he does so we see Claire standin her bedroom window, smiling gently, having observed it al

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Claire is sitting in reception. She looks a little anxiou Charlie comes down the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She’s not in her room.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Have you checked the dining room?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: This is my fault. He goes over to the desk.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Has Miss Marcus checked out? He looks at the register.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Have you seen her at all this morning?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: I’m afraid not sir. At this point Charlie sees her coming into the hotel. He hugely relieved.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (a little too brightly) Morning!  81.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Everything alright? I thought...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Thought what?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Nothing. You OK?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. Why wouldn't I be? Claire smiles - registering their awkwardness. Sophia tur to her.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Are you excited? I’m so excited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright and early. The car speeds along a dusty country ro along the perimeter of a vast vineyard. They pass a sign that says “D’Annunzio Vineyards. 1961”.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The car stops at a large farm house nestled in the midst the vineyard. The vines are bursting with young blue grap As Claire steps out of the car, she looks around and sees something in the distance that nearly stops her breathing A handsome YOUNG MAN, around 16, shirtless, solid and bro from the sun, he works repairing an irrigation line. He looks up and sees the three strangers in his driveway and smiles a shy welcome. Claire can’t believe her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: My God. That’s him. That’s Alfonso.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That can’t actually be him.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: If it is then I'm writing a completely different article.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Are you Alfonso D'Annunzio?  82.

dialogues.speaker: ALFONSO III
dialogues.text: Yes, ma'am. At that moment, a middle-aged man comes round the corner. is ALFONSO D’ANNUNZIO, JR., Alfonso III’s father. ALFONSO III’S FATHER Did someone call me?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Are you Alfonso D'Annunzio too? Before he can answer a voice comes from inside the house. DON ALFONSO’S VOICE I know that voice. Suddenly a sweet old man, tanned from the sun, comes step out of the house. He is DON ALFONSO PAOLO D’ANNUNZIO. He looks at the three strangers - then focuses on Claire. Without saying a word, Claire smiles, she knows this is h The young man from all those years ago. It’s the eyes. As she walks toward him, he stares at her, disbelieving, years and years flicker through his memories.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: Claire? She nods. The tears are already starting to form. And she not the only one as Sophia hastily wipes a tear away. Claire and Alfonso stop opposite each other. They stare i each other’s eyes, older certainly, yet indelibly etched each other's hearts. There's a long silence. Neither sure what to say or do. Claire manages a coy little smile.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sorry I'm late. Alfonso smiles. He opens his arms. She walks into them. Claire and Don Alfonso embrace. Everyone watching, smilin Something prompts Sophia to look down. It’s Charlie’s han reaching out for hers. She takes it and looks up at Charl He turns to her, his eyes looking suspiciously tearful. H about to say something but can’t. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You’re welcome.  83.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A space behind the D’Annunzio house filled with tables an trees. The vineyard's all around. Don Alfonso’s big famil out en masse to celebrate the reunion of their patriarch his childhood sweetheart. Four generations: CHILDREN, GRANDCHILDREN, AND GREAT- GRANDCHILDREN. Tables laden with food. Claire and Don Alfonso sit together drinking and catching after the years of separation. Sophia is surrounded by sprightly D’Annunzio grandchildre who play a game with her. She stops and looks around as s realizes someone is missing. She goes off in search of Charlie. She finds him alone by some trees staring at the horizon. He's deep in thought. She takes a moment to just watch hi She smiles then walks up slowly.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: He's a widower, just lost his wife two years ago. And now Claire. Here. On his doorstep after fifty years... how does that happen?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You made it happen. Sophia smiles. Charlie goes back to staring at the horizo

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Happy or sad? I can’t tell.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Bit of both actually. Happy for them. A little sad it’s over.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Mission accomplished.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: If you like.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You have to admit it was kinda fun.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It was. Pause.  84.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: About last night.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Mistakes happen.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: A mistake. Yeah. They look at each other, both not telling the truth, both knowing it, neither has the courage to take the first ste

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (ever so slightly fishing) I mean there’s no need to apologize if that’s what you're trying to do? A beat as he decides which way to go.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. 'Cause that's what I was trying to do. I was trying to apologize.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But there’s no need.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Course not. Good.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sorted. Another awkward silence. Sophia tries to fill the silence

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (overly flippant) Bottle of chianti, an Italian night sky, and some childhood trauma, I could be anyone's. That's not what he wanted to hear. He looks hurt.  85.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Guess you'll do anything to get your story. That came out colder than he meant it. She look's hurt.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What does that mean? He shrugs. They look at each other long and hard, trying read each other. And then Claire suddenly approaches.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have come here. They both just stare at her for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What is it Claire? What happened?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Too much has happened, dear. It's been fifty years. I'm behaving like a school girl. You were right, Charlie. This was selfish and impulsive and I'm sorry. Don Alfonso appears at Claire’s side.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: Claire... She smiles softly at him.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I should go. It was good to see you again. Really. Sophia looks at Charlie as if say "Do something." He take Claire's hand.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You can’t just pitch up here out of the blue and then bugger off. It’s just not fair on the poor bloke. Claire turns to Don Alfonso.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It was foolish. Barging back into your life like this. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE (cont'd) How could we possibly pick up where we left off a life time ago? He smiles warmly at her - he understands what she's feeli

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: Claire, my angel, slow down. It won't happen in a day. Nothing worth doing is done in a day. Claire sighs. Calming a bit.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: We'll talk... Be friends... have dinner... take it slow... we’1l write letters... you can tell me about Jack... and I‘’11 tell you about my bladder operations. This unexpected image makes Claire smile despite herself. long as he’s bravely confessing things:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I have varicose veins.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: So do I. And my hearing.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: My eyes are going.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: We're a little old, like Da Vinci's Last Supper, falling apart a little. But what a masterpiece, no? He takes her hand. Looks in her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: What are you afraid of?

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Maybe I’m afraid to be happy again.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: There are so many worse things to be afraid of at our age. He takes her hand and smiles sweetly. She smiles back comforted by his words. They hug each other reassuringly. He turns to Charlie and holds out his hand. Charlie takes  87.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: Come. I’1l show you some vines that are even older than me. Charlie turns to Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You coming? Sophia looks at him - still a bit hurt. She shakes her he

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You go. I should get back.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Need to get to work on that story. That's what I'm here for, right? A silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Right. They look at each other. Both looking like they want to s more. Neither does. Then they turn around and walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia's lying on the bed writing on her laptop when her phone rings. She answers.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Hey. How's Palermo? Still need me to pick you up tomorrow morning? INTERCUT: Victor getting of a small single-engine plane.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: It was great. I'm back. Caught an early flight. Can you come get me? Sophia is startled, taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh. Yeah. Sure. OK. Uh. On my way.  88.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia heads down to the Fiat Cinquecento. She gets in an drives off. Just as soon as she's out of sight... Charlie’s car arrives at the hotel. He gets out and walks Claire follows him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie is at the front desk with Claire.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: She left a few minutes ago.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: She did?

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: For the airport.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The airport? Did she leave a message? The receptionist looks.

dialogues.speaker: RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: No sir. No message. Pause.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I can't believe she'd run off.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: It's simple. She’s frightened. Go after her Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: No. She's not...

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Oh don’t be so proud.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I’m not. Really. It’s for the best.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Don’t make the same mistake I did. Pause. He looks at her. She smiles warmly and strokes the side of his face. He suddenly sprints out of the hotel.  89. Claire turns back to the Receptionist.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: We'd like to check out please. We’re gonna be staying with friends for the rest of our trip. The Receptionist starts processing the paper work.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie runs into the Terminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He rushes up to the departure monitor. The only New York flight on the monitor has closed. He’s too late. He looks at it carefully then leaves, disconsolate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks out of the terminal back to the car park structure. As he does so, Sophia can be seen further down concourse with Victor loading his luggage into the Fiat. Charlie waits in line for the paying machine. If only they’d turn round. But they don’t. Charlie doesn’t see her and she doesn’t see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia and Victor walk into the lobby.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Why don’t you take your luggage upstairs, I'll be up in a minute.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Sure. He goes to kiss her. She moves imperceptibly so that the lands on her cheek instead of her lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia walks. There is now a FEMALE RECEPTIONIST on the d  90.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Have you seen Mister Smith or his grandmother this evening?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: They checked out about an hour ago.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Checked out? Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Did they leave a message?

dialogues.speaker: FEMALE RECEPTIONIST
dialogues.text: (checks ) No miss.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh. OK. She thinks for a moment. Then Victor appears.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I was thinking we could head over for one last meal with Angelina. He notices her lost in her head.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Everything alright?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah... everything’s fine. He puts an arm around her and leads her out of the hotel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and Sophia sit together. Victor has polished off a plate of Angelina's meatballs. Sophia hardly touched hers Bella comes to clear their plates. She smiles at Sophia. Sophia can only manage a meek smile back. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: --.-I did a lot of thinking while I was in Palermo. About the restaurant, about it's future, about our future. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: VICTOR (cont'd) And I realized I can't do it without you. I want you with me. Sophia shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Victor, I... Victor theatrically drops down on one knee. Sophia has lo on her face that says "Oh God, here we go again".

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Sophia? Will you be...

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Victor, I don't want to run your... Before she can finish the sentence, Victor pulls out and opens a jewelry box. There's a diamond ring in it. She ga

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: My wife? Sophia just stares at the ring. She's speechless. She jus stares. Victor slides the ring on her finger before she answers. Now she's staring at it on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE SHOT: Of the diamond sparkling on her finger. Sophia stands at the window, ready for bed, looking at th garden below, where she and Charlie lay looking at the st the night before. Then she looks at the ring. She sighs. Victor comes up behind her and wraps his arms around her.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: We should get some sleep. Early flight tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. She takes a last look at the garden and follows him in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie stands in his bedroom window looking out at the Italian night sky. He looks sad. FADE TO BLACK.  92.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not big but beautifully put together in a provincial Italian style. All along the walls are huge blown up phot of Victor and his Italian suppliers - the truffle hunter, butcher, etc. - which Sophia took in Italy. The place is packed. Not a table empty in the house. WAITERS and WAITRESSES scurry about. LINE COOKS fire entr And at the center of it all, in his element, is Victor barking orders, he's intense but enjoying every second. We pick up Mark - Victor's bartender - taking an entree o the line. He carries it through the restaurant to the fro of the house where we find Sophia sitting by herself at t bar. He sets the entree in front of her with a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things have calmed down some. The place is still crowded the dinner rush has subsided. Victor is out visiting tables of HIGH SOCIETY TYPES. They bathe him in praise. He plays the role of humble well. So watches him from the mostly empty bar where she sits sipp a glass of wine. Mark is polishing wine glasses behind th bar. He sees her watching him.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Can you believe how quickly it's all happening? He deserves it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I can. And he does.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: You must be proud of him. She smirks - maybe a little tipsy from the wine.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I must be. The Bar Tender gestures to the ring on her finger.

dialogues.speaker: MARK
dialogues.text: Have you set the date yet? She looks at her diamond.  93.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: We're still... "waiting for things to settle down."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Victor and his STAFF are finishing up for the night. Prep for tomorrow. Sophia walks in with her coat on.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You about ready? Victor doesn't even glance up from what he's doing.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You know what. Just go ahead. I'll catch up. See you at home. Sophia sighs in a way that tells us this has become routi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia at home alone on her couch with her laptop. We find her as we first found her up late working on a column. Only without the drying pasta hung everywhere. And without Victor. She's not working so much as staring at the screen. It's quiet. She glances at the clock: It's three a.m.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is out with friends having drinks. She's with a GR OF COUPLES. Victor is conspicuously absent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the middle of the night. Victor snores in the bedroo Sophia sits alone on the couch watching TV looking bored. has a thought. She searches through her desk drawer and p out the little slip of paper that Claire wrote her number She checks the clock. It's 3:30 in New York. 9:30 in Lond Not too early to call. She dials the number. There's an English ring tone. After minute an answering machine picks up:

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hi. You've reached Claire and Charlie. There's no one here at the moment. But if you'd like to... At this point the phone is picked up at the other end.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Hello? Sophia freezes. She can’t speak.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Hello? In the background Claire can be heard.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE 0/S
dialogues.text: Who is it dear?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Don’t know. Hello? She quickly puts the receiver down - heart pounding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia approaches Victor’s Restaurant from across the str She stops and watches through the front window. Victor is visible in the open-air kitchen at the back, cooking, ordering, examining plates on the service pass. It's fully booked again. PEOPLE who haven’t booked are being turned away. At the f of house desk - where Sophia could've been - stands a beautifully elegant HOSTESS. Sophia so clearly doesn’t feel a part of this. How quickl things move on. She sighs and crosses the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A closet-sized office in the back of the restaurant. Soph and Victor eat together in silence. This is the time they spend together now.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Bono was here last Friday.  95.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Nice. They go back to eating in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is on her way out when she passes a chubby man eat alone. It's Bobby. He's got a tomato-stained napkin tucke his shirt just below his chin. Sophia approaches. He smil

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Your boy can cook.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So I've heard.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Thanks for getting me the table.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: It's what I do. He smiles. Pulls out a chair for her.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Sit down. Have a drink with me. She does. He signals the waiter to bring another wine gla

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: So... I finally got around to reading those pages you sent me... Sophia's not exactly sure what he's talking about.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: "Does True Love Have a Shelf Life?"

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Oh. Right. What'd you think?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Not bad. I liked it. I think people would like it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Who are the "people" you're always referring to?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Advertisers mostly.  96. She smiles. Bobby pours her a glass of wine.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Why didn't you finish it? Sophia isn't quite sure what he means.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You didn't like the ending?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: There is no ending.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Of course there's an ending. She found him. They reconnected.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You never answer your own question. You never followed up. Sophia's not sure where he's going with this. He smiles l he knows something she doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: It's the grandson isn't it?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I read what you wrote remember. It's all there on the page.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I hardly wrote anything about Char-- I mean the grandson.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Exactly. Sophia shakes her head. Takes a gulp of wine.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Well like I said it showed potential. Maybe it's time we talk about the next step. Maybe there is more you can contribute.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Like contribute creatively? Or...  97.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Slow down. You got potential. But you got work to do. You got a voice but you don't always use it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: But you want me to try something new? Bobby smiles. He shrugs playing coy.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Come into my office on Monday. We'll talk. Sophia suddenly can't stop smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is changing for bed when she hears Victor come in. She's still smiling. Victor walks into the room yawning.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Guess what?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Too tired to guess. Just tell me.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Bobby liked my story.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: What story?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Claire's story. He says I've got a voice. He wants to talk about maybe taking the next step. Isn't that great?

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Yeah... Yeah... Very gr... (he yawns so "great" sounds like "gruh") Victor's too tired to show any enthusiasm. And we get the feeling even if he weren't he wouldn't. He yawns again.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: That's all you got is "very gruh"? He flops down on the bed. Kicks off his shoes.  98.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I'm happy for you. I've also been on my feet for nineteen hours. G'night. He closes his eyes. Sophia just stands there watching him

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Victor this isn't working. He opens his eyes but doesn't look at her.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: And whose fault is that? She looks at him. He sits up with a frustrated sigh. He yawns.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You see? This is why. This is why I wanted you with me. I asked you to be my front of house precisely to avoid this situation.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You asked me to be your wife. And I never see you. That's the situation. There's no avoiding it.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: Do we have to do this now? You're being unreasonable.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: There isn't anything reasonable about love, Victor. Victor can see where this is headed. He gets defensive.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You knew what the restaurant was gonna require... You knew I'd be working long hours... You knew what it would mean... You knew there'd be sacrifice... You knew that... Silence. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: You knew this was who I was.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: And what I'm trying to tell you is I'm not who I was. He's silent at this - what can he say.

dialogues.speaker: VICTOR
dialogues.text: I didn't do anything wrong. She walks up to him.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You're not wrong. I'm not wrong. We're just wrong for each other. And there it is. She takes off her engagement ring and pl it in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The leaves are starting to turn in central park.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia is in her weekly staff meeting with Bobby and all rest of his WRITERS. Bobby is at the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: ...And finally I need a follow up on last summer's piece on the mayor. I know a week in city hall isn't anyone's idea of a vacation. Bobby looks right at Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You got it? She nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia has moved. The place is furnished but still coming together. She's working on her laptop. She seems to be immersed ful in what she's writing. She's focused not stressed.  100. There's a knock at her door. She answers and finds a MAIL who hands her a thick bundle of forwarded mail - presumab from Victor's. She sorts through it. Then she stops at an envelope. It has an Italian stamp an post mark. She opens it quickly. It’s an invitation. CLAIRE’S VOICE Mrs. Claire Smith and Don Alfonso D’Annunzio invite you to the wedding of Mrs. Claire Smith to Don Alfonso D’Annunzio. Then scribbled across the bottom in large letters. CLAIRE’S VOICE Please come darling. You must. Sophia beams.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sophia stands in front of Bobby. He looks at the invitati

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: You going to finish that story? He hands her back the invitation. She looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I don't know. I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: Really? A beat as he takes this in. She kind of shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: BOBBY
dialogues.text: I'll give you the week. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PEOPLE are starting to arrive at a beautiful Medieval Ita village church. A taxi pulls up and Sophia gets out. She looks stunning in a simple pale suit. She looks nervo as she surveys the picturesque scene. She walks towards the church.  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she enters the church and makes her way through the cr of GUESTS, young and old, we can tell that she's looking

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE 0/S
dialogues.text: Sophia... And there he is. She turns to find him smiling at her. Dressed in a traditional English morning suit, tails, waistcoat, the works. One might even say he looks dashing He approaches. She suddenly seems very nervous.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Hi!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: (forgets she already said) Hi... They do an awkward hug/kiss on the cheek thing.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You look great.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm glad you came. You look pretty good yourself.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: How could I not? Come, I mean, not look...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I got it. A beat of awkward silence. They smile at each other - smi that say "Why is this so uncomfortable?" Finally.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: You came alone?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Yeah. I did. Sorry I didn't RSVP. I just moved. A beat as Charlie registers this.  102.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's fine. Whole thing's been a bit of a shotgun affair really... (he smiles at her) I'm glad you came. She smiles hoping it's for the reason she thinks it is.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO 0/S
dialogues.text: There she is. There's our angel. Sophia turns to find Don Alfonso beaming at her. She's visibly taken aback at his appearance. He's so much thinn and what little hair he had left has turned a shade greye he walks with a cane now and has a pronounced limp but st he looks like royalty in a fine Italian tuxedo. His grand Alfonso III, escorts him on his way. Don Alfonso stops and kisses Sophia on both cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: DON ALFONSO
dialogues.text: Thank you for coming.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Wouldn't miss it for the world.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Papa, they need you at the altar. He smiles and kisses Sophia's hand before continuing on i the church. Sophia watches him limping on that cane. She turns and looks at Charlie. She doesn't even have to ask.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He fell. About two months ago. He and Gran were walking in his fields. Tripped on vine. Shattered his hip. Had to have it replaced. Sophia watches Don Alfonso smiling and welcoming guests a slowly makes his way down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: That's terrible.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Saved his life actually. Sophia turns back to Charlie who takes a breath before:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: He only fell a few feet but the hip shattered like a vase. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHARLIE (cont'd) (beat) A tumor had hollowed it out. Sophia just stares - speechless.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Is he OK... Is he...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: They think a year, maybe two, maybe more, maybe less. Different doctors give different answers, none of them straight, you know how it goes.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: My god... How awful... Charlie looks with a smile at Don Alfonso who has finally made it to his place at the altar. He shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Actually they've been extraordinary. Really. It's humbling. They're living proof that if you find love for even the shortest moment, you have to grab it with both hands... Charlie catches himself being sincere. He tries to play i off with a wry shrug and smile.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Tis better to have loved... and all that. She manages a smile back.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: And all that. They look at each other for a long moment. Sophia looks a she's about to say something when...

dialogues.speaker: PATRICIA 0O/S
dialogues.text: There you are. At that moment a strikingly beautiful English woman in a that matches Charlie's suit approaches. She is PATRICIA.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICIA
dialogues.text: You need to get outside. She'll be here any second.  104. Sophia just stares at her. Momentarily speechless.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Patricia. This is Sophia. Doing her best to hide her disappointment:

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Hi. Realization flashes in Patricia's flawless eyes.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICIA
dialogues.text: The Sophia.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The Sophia. Sophia shrugs and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICIA
dialogues.text: Oh it's so nice to finally meet you. You're kind of a legend around here you know. A silent beat. Patricia turns to Charlie.

dialogues.speaker: PATRICIA
dialogues.text: I'll see you up there. Don't trip.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: As if I'm not nervous enough. She kisses his cheek, smiles at Sophia, and heads off dow the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: She's beautiful...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Scrubs up well I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: And is she... Before she can ask the question an old Italian limousine rolls to a stop at the front steps as Alfonso III walks u

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: And there she is. Places everyone. (to Alfonso III) Can you show Sophia to a seat?  105. Alfonso III hold out his arm. Sophia takes it. She looks Charlie. He looks at her and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Show time. Charlie heads out to the white limo as Alfonso III ushers Sophia down the aisle. The church is idyllic, festooned w white flowers everywhere. The floral arrangements at the of the pews contain bunches of dark purple grapes. The Secretaries of Juliet are together in a pew. They wav Sophia as she passes. Bella, ever the romantic, is alread crying, handkerchief in hand. When Sophia gets to a seat she looks to the altar where D Alfonso stands waiting for his bride. He turns to look at Sophia. He smiles sweetly then closes his eyes for a few seconds in a silent expression of gratitude. She smiles. Then the organ begins and a hush falls over the congregat Charlie escorts Claire down the aisle. She looks beautifu All the excitement and radiance of a teenage bride. As they pass she sees Sophia and her whole face just ligh up. She gives her a discreet wave. Sophia smiles and wave back but it's all too much and the tears begin to come. Charlie walks Claire to Don Alfonso. He gives her away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE WEDDING PARTY is led through the narrow streets of th village towards the vineyard by a loud brass band. VILLAGERS outside bars stand and applaud. Others lean out upstairs windows throwing confetti, whistling and cheerin Alfonso walks arm-in-arm with Claire at the center of it Beside them. Patricia and Charlie and Alfonso's son and grandson. And lastly the gathering of GUESTS. Sophia is among the f cluster just behind the wedding party. Everyone's eyes ar The Bride and Groom except Sophia who's watching Charlie. The parade continues. It's a colorful, joyous carnival of occasion. A day not soon forgotten in this little village  106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tables have been laid for the wedding feast. The BAND pla CHILDREN run around. FRIENDS and FAMILY chat and laugh. At the head table sit the bride and groom. Charlie and Patricia are seated on either side of them. Sophia is at another table with the Secretaries of Juliet She steals glances at Charlie over her glass of wine. Charlie stands and taps his glass. Everyone turns to him. The band stops and silence falls. Charlie clears his thro

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: It's been a sincere honor giving away my Gran today. Though she's left me in the market for a room mate if anyone knows anyone... some light cooking and laundry required. This gets a chuckle. Charlie smiles at Claire as he says:

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I'm not allowed to make a speech... Someone shouts “Shame!”

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: So I'll just get right to it then... Ladies and Gentlemen, may I present for the first time Mr. and Mrs. Alfonso D'Annunzio... Everyone stands and cheers. Claire and Alfonso kiss.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Now I believe Mrs. D'Annunzio would like to say a few words... Gran? Everyone claps. Claire kisses Charlie and stands. He sits

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: I won’t keep you long as I'm sure most of you have heard the story of how my husband... Everyone cheers and whistles at the first mention of the word. She smiles. It gets quiet again.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Fifty-seven-years ago I wrote a letter that asked a question. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLAIRE (cont'd) Fifty-seven years later I got an answer. (she looks right at) Sophia? Dear? Would you stand up? Sophia hesitates then stands reluctantly. She turns red w embarrassment. Charlie smiles at this.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: Sophia gave me my answer. Everyone starts clapping and cheering her as Claire unfol piece of paper. Sophia recognizes it - turns redder.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: She wrote me a letter. This letter. Without it, none of this would've been possible, none of us would be here today, and so it seems only fitting to share some of it... (she starts reading) "'What' and ‘if’ two words as non- threatening as words come. But put them together side-by-side and they have the power to haunt you for the rest of your life: ‘What if?'..." She looks at Sophia now and basically reads the letter to as if no one else were there.

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: "I don't know how your story ended. But I know that if what you felt then was love - true love - then it's never too late. If it was true then it why wouldn't it be true now? You need only the courage to follow your heart..." Sophia is looking at Charlie who looks straight back at h

dialogues.speaker: CLAIRE
dialogues.text: "I don't know what a love like that feels like... a love to leave loved ones for, a love to cross oceans for... but I'd like to believe if I ever felt it. I'd have the courage to seize it. I hope you had the courage to seize it, Claire. And if you didn't, I hope one day that you will." She folds the letter and looks at Sophia - we can see the glaze of tears forming as everyone starts clapping.  108. Charlie sees those tears forming too. Sophia looks at him sitting there beside Patricia and the abruptly turns and walks off away from the gathering. The tears have started to fall. She wipes them away.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to go. Charlie watches Sophia go. He catches Claire looking at h as if to say "What are you waiting for?" A beat. Then he gets up and goes after her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Charlie walks around to the front of the house.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia? He walks to the front door and calls inside.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia? He walks round the corner towards the vineyards and looks down the rows of fruit laden vines.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia? He goes back towards the house and then spots her in a fi floor window redoing her make up in front of a mirror. A grows up this side of the house up to and beyond the wind He walks up to the house and shouts from below.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Sophia? She looks out of the window - it should, of course, be reminiscent of Shakespeare's balcony scene.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I’m leaving.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have come here.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Did you listen to what Gran just said? To what you wrote?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I’m happy for you. She’s gorgeous. Not at all how I imagined.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Patricia.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Patricia? She’s my cousin.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Your cousin? Good God. Is that legal in England?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Different girl. Same name. She’s like a sister to me. And a daughter to Gran. We practically grew up together after, you know... This gives Sophia pause. She looks down at him.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Don’t go.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Why? Why should I stay, Charlie? He starts to climb the vine towards her with some difficu

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What are you doing?!

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: The thing is I’ve watched Gran and Alfonso over the last few months... and I've realized... that I can’t wait fifty years to say... He’s level with her now but has to pause to get his breat

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: ---I love you, Sophia.  110.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: That kiss wasn't a mistake. Poorly timed yeah. But not a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: You love me?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So why are you looking at me like that?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Terrified.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I remembered about half way up the vine I’m a bit scared of heights. She looks at him. Smiles.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: I love you too. Slight pause. She leans into kiss him. But he doesn't mov

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: So are you gonna kiss me? Or...

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: I would. Yeah. It’s just that I appear to have lost my foot-- And with that he disappears from the window - screaming a the way down until he hits with a thud.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Charlie! She looks down to see him lying prostrate in a bush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rushes through the villa, down the stairs, and out through the hall to the front yard.  111. She runs up to him. He's moaning in pain.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: (groans) Please tell me no one saw that. Sophia looks up and sees the entire wedding party looking Charlie lying there.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: No one saw it.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Good.

dialogues.speaker: SOPHIA
dialogues.text: Can you move? He stays completely still as he smiles.

dialogues.speaker: CHARLIE
dialogues.text: Only my lips. She leans over and kisses him as Claire and Alfonso watch approvingly from a distance. As we... FADE TO BLACK. “LA FINE"
